skill.name: enact/text-summarizer
skill.description: A tool that analyzes text and provides statistics including word count, character count, sentence count, average word length, and estimated reading time.
skill.summary: Text analysis tool that provides word count, character count, and reading time statistics
skill.author: EnactProtocol

security_audit.summary: Static analyzer flagged 13 potential issues but all are false positives. Backtick patterns are markdown code fences (SKILL.md) and template literals (summarize.js:35). The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' flags are misfires triggered by the word 'algorithm' in text descriptions (calculating averages, reading time). The skill is a simple text statistics tool with no network, file system, or command injection risks.

medium_findings.title: Ruby/Shell Backtick Execution (False Positive)
medium_findings.description: Static analyzer detected backticks at SKILL.md:54,56,68 and summarize.js:35. These are markdown code fences and JavaScript template literals, not code execution. The skill does not use backtick command substitution.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Lines 54-56 are markdown code blocks, line 68 is a JSON code fence, and line 35 is a JavaScript template literal for string interpolation - none of these execute code.

medium_findings.title: Weak Cryptographic Algorithm (False Positive)
medium_findings.description: Static analyzer flagged lines in SKILL.md as using weak crypto. These lines contain plain text descriptions using the word 'algorithm' in the mathematical sense (calculation methods), not cryptographic algorithms.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: These lines contain plain text descriptions like 'Average word length' and 'Reading time estimation'. No cryptographic code or operations exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Users need quick insights into text content without manual counting. This tool automatically calculates word count, character count, sentence count, and reading time for any text input.
actual_capabilities: Counts total words in any text string
Estimates number of sentences using punctuation markers
Computes average word length in characters
Estimates reading time based on 200 words per minute
limitations: Sentence detection is basic and may not handle all punctuation patterns
Reading time assumes average reading speed of 200 words per minute
Does not detect language or provide translation
No summarization capability despite skill name

use_cases.title: Content writer checking article length
use_cases.description: Writers can quickly verify word count and estimated reading time before publishing articles or blog posts.

use_cases.title: Developer validating text input
use_cases.description: Integrate this skill into workflows that need to validate or log text content metrics for processing pipelines.

use_cases.title: Researcher analyzing survey responses
use_cases.description: Researchers can efficiently analyze length and complexity of open-ended survey responses across multiple entries.

prompt_templates.title: Basic text analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the text-summarizer skill to analyze this text: ${text}
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick statistics for any text input

prompt_templates.title: Batch text comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Use text-summarizer to analyze both passages and compare their lengths and complexity.

prompt_templates.title: Content length validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if this content meets the requirements of at least ${min_words} words and ${max_reading_time} minutes reading time.

prompt_templates.title: Writing workflow integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the draft and provide statistics. Then suggest improvements if the reading time exceeds ${max_minutes} minutes.

output_examples.input: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

Natural language processing enables computers to understand human language. It combines computational linguistics with machine learning models. Applications include translation, sentiment analysis, and text summarization.

best_practices: Use for quick statistics checks rather than as a substitute for manual proofreading
Combine with other skills for comprehensive content analysis workflows
Consider reading time estimates as approximate guidance
anti_patterns: Do not use for precise legal or academic document requirements
Avoid relying on sentence count for complex multi-clause sentences
Do not expect language-specific text analysis

faq.question: What reading speed does the skill use?
faq.answer: The skill estimates reading time at 200 words per minute, which is a common average for adult readers.

faq.question: Does it count words with hyphens as one or two?
faq.answer: The skill uses standard whitespace splitting, so hyphenated words are typically counted as single words.

faq.question: Can I analyze text in languages other than English?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with any language but sentence detection may be less accurate for languages with different punctuation.

faq.question: Does the skill modify or store the input text?
faq.answer: No, the skill only reads the input to compute statistics and returns the results without storing data.

faq.question: What happens with empty text input?
faq.answer: Empty or whitespace-only input returns zero values for all statistics.

faq.question: Does this skill actually summarize text?
faq.answer: No, despite the name, this skill provides statistics and metrics, not text summarization. It counts words, characters, and estimates reading time.
